@baloobas1 I think it's just another 'this generation doesn't understand art, they're ruined by social media'. Used to be MTV, before that the television, before that the cinema, before that the radio, before that a different god.....

We don't dismiss our colleagues if they don't like what we like, we shouldn't dismiss our students for the same thing. (Unless the film they like is Inside I'm Dancing, in that case they should be shunned)

What we shouldn't do is try to 'make' them like a particular poem, play, or film. Hopefully they will but if they don't, that's OK. Criticising them for not liking what you like is elitist, dismissive and hubristic.

I'm old (according to my children and my students) and I find 2001 and Barry Lyndon boring. Students can like what they want. As teachers we should be asking them to appreciate the art, the creativity, what is being discussed and how it is being discussed. https://t.co/MUmvCik1MB
